page.title: 08SHEEP MANAGEMENT/CLANFIELD
page.content: Because of the high cost of labour, many people who have a large area of land around their houses, run a few sheep to keep the grass under control. Each winter the Country Park Centre, in conjunction with Hampshire College of Agriculture,organises a three day sheep management course to help these people.Facilities are also made available for the compulsory dipping of sheep against fly and scab.A sheep shearing service is also available which provides an interesting and educational experience for visitors to the Country Park.Television has made sheep dog trials very popular as a spectator sport.Competitions are held each year for local farmers and shepherds.The trials are organised by the Butser Shepherds Society which provides visitors with the chance to see the shepherd and his dog at work.
